intro: Ficinia lateralis, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its unique, zigzagging stems that give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Ficinia lateralis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
